title: ‘It was a good company to work for, but the work life made life miserable.’
pros: The benefits and discounts were amazing and the support network was pretty good too. The pay was alright.
cons: The work/ life balance was horrendous and there was no wiggle room with shifts. The parking in the area was terribly expensive too.

title: ‘Happy friendly fulfilling anc challenging work environment.’
pros: Friendly, stable,great team i am working with. opportunity for advancement and to step up in other roles. great training and education
cons:
Management lack of communication
maintaining staff due to low pay
sometimes lack of transparency

title: ‘Love working at Bupa.’
pros:
Love working at Bupa!
Love being apatlrt of such a fantastic company who devote so much towards the care of our wonderful residents.
cons: There are certainly days which are challenging but the experience of being able to care for our residents on a daily basis is exactly why we do it day in day out.

title: ‘One of the best cultures I’ve encountered in a company - I miss my Bupa family.’
pros: Amazing culture. I was fortunate to have had some really brilliant managers and colleagues. It can be hard work but the perks and team fun are worth it. Bupa really cared for it’s people as well as it’s customers as well - skin checks, massages, Christmas hampers, heavily discounted insurance - all amazing.
cons: There is a very long tenure here so opportunities for career progression were limited in the city I was based in.

title: ‘Bupa truely promotes a work life balance.’
pros: True to company values, promotes and encourages healthy and happy lives, and gives you opportunity to grow with the business.
cons: My department needs an overhaul for procedures but has allowed and encouraged me to do this which is fantastic.

title: ‘Great working environment to grow as an employee and work amongst decent hard working people.’
pros: Always looking to develop you and build responsibilities. Salary reflects the work you do in the practice
cons: Previously a private dental practice, the challenge has been the change over to bupa and learning the way things work
location: Five Dock, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Caring company with good perks.’
pros: Very good perks and senior management that very caring of staff.  Great opportunities for career development if you are happy to work in head office
cons: Pay isn't great and sales targets are high.

title: ‘Poor work life with Bupa..’
pros: Generally office hours worked...
cons: No staff to service customers, high KPI's basically you will be a sales person pushing  expensive products that people don't need... Very poor bonus scheme.

title: ‘Fun, interesting, rewarding.’
pros: Dynamic environment, good people, nice benefits, positive philosophy.
cons: It was changing very quickly, which is one of the things I liked about it, but theoretically challenging. There was a huge amount of complex work in the pipeline, moist - if not all - would now be completed.

title: ‘I would thoroughly recommend the company as a whole to work for. Amazing opportunities and training was outstanding.’
pros: The work/  life balance. Always felt like an individual and not just a number. Really enjoyed my time with the company. Great incentives and KPI targets were very fair.
cons: A somewhat negative manager at the end of my time with the company was my biggest challenge. Did not feel supported by the individual store management team at the time of leaving the company.

title: ‘A company that cares and rewards hard work’
pros: Bupa genuinely cares for its customers and its employees. You get subsidised health insurance, flexible working hours and a sense that you're doing something of value in the community.
cons: Bupa's got offices throughout the country, but its Head Office is Melbourne, meaning that any career progression tends to require a move to Melbourne. If you're content with an entry level - lower management role, Brisbane is fine. But otherwise, if you aspire for more, your career will reach its ceiling here in Brisbane pretty quickly.

title: ‘Fantastic company who truly care about the health of its clients and customers.’
pros: The diverse range of career opportunities is outstanding. You can work almost anywhere in the world in sales, IT, health promotion, medical, optical, dental, aged care and more. Its profits aren't paid to board members or stockholders. They are used to improve the quality of health and care of people worldwide.
cons: Having an international business means that your team may not necessarily be in the same state or country as you. Video conferencing has to occur at times outside of work hours.

title: ‘Finally found an organization with worklife/balance that cares about its employees’
pros:
*Really friendly, open, supportive environment
*Practices what it preaches, focused on employee's health & wellbeing with various wellness initiatives available 
*A true work/life balance with flexible work hours and ability to work from home
*Plenty of growth opportunities throughout the business
cons: *Salaries are fair but could be more competitive, however the positive work culture helps make up for it

title: ‘Not really impressed about respect for people’
pros: I worked as a casual for a couple of months did a great job applied for a couple of full time roles they would not even give me an interview for the roles after I did my job they couldnt wait for me to finish my contract they dont want to help people and they dont care about people even though they are a health company
cons: Dealing with people that should not be doing the job they are doing

title: ‘Hard work is well recognised and rewarded.’
pros: Great environment. Real team mindset. Wonderful formal (& in-formal) opportunities for development.
cons: Working with people who just want to clock in and clock out, but that is a challenge at any job.

title: ‘I recommend this to people, caring for residents is great here’
pros: Management - amazing and approachable, beautiful family members of residents, staff to work with are generally wonderful people, reward their staff with perks and thank you gifts from management, great further opportunities within facility
cons: Average to low pay rate

title: ‘Frustrating.’
pros: Some of the other staff were nice.
cons: Management was poor. I didn't receive proper training for the role. No one took responsibility for my training, everyone just said it was someone else's job to do it. Then I got told off for not doing my job correctly/efficiently.

title: ‘Great work environment too bad only hiring temps’
pros: Being a claim processor, we have reasonable work load and great work environment with professional barista making coffee for us during work hours.
cons: Unfortunately Bupa doesn't offer full time positions to claim processors so the whole floor is temps.

title: ‘Work hard because you love working to Bupa’
pros: They are flexible with work arrangements and offer a great career path to nurses but professionals from other backgrounds have very limited opportunities.
cons: The work load is insane and as most of the big companies the communication is poor and the decision/resolutions process is very slow.

title: ‘I enjoy coming to work everyday!’
pros:
Great culture, people and work life balance. Approachable and available leadership team. 
Great state office locations.
cons:
Although the pay is average, the benefits that accompany it are great.
Bupa cares about their people, with great insurance discounts and their wellness calendar of events throughout the year.

title: ‘A valuable learning experience in a supportive environment.’
pros: Supportive, reward and recognition, opportunity to develop, pay increases and bonuses.
cons: Call centre work can be draining, but with the right motivation it's also rewarding.

title: ‘Great fun but low pay, no bonus yet high performance’
pros: Work friends and travel, good equipment direct manager was sensational love working with a great team of nurses.
cons: Communication when advised of issues they often went unheard as did provision of information at ground level. Hence, problems evolved

title: ‘Great place to be till you find a better one’
pros: Very good work place environment, good degree of transparency, work life balance,  proactive and approachable management
cons: Not enough career opportunities,  rigidity in procedures but getting better

title: ‘It was a great journey as the company grew in size and new businesses.’
pros: Excellent CIO, culture changing towards right direction, becoming more agile. Mangers are supportive. Technology stack is quite up to date, moving to cloud for new systems. Good training/conference opportunities provided.
cons: Too big ambition within too little timeframe leading to prioritization of work issues. Too many stakeholders to satisfy for approval of work. Many still haven't embraced agile way of working.

title: ‘Loved working here, was sorry to leave.’
pros: The above and beyond staff
cons: High changeover of management, resulting with many changed and attitudes.

title: ‘A lot of PR rather than behin-the-scenes substance.’
pros: Generally a friendly working environment.
cons: Not enough experienced clinical staff, lack of leadership.

title: ‘I always think about going back to work for Bupa above all other companies I have worked for.’
pros: Work life balance and overall culture of the business ,excellent training
cons: Sales targets can sometimes be challenging but there was always multiple opportunities to learn and improve

title: ‘The best place’
pros: Good place and fantastic team
cons: Nice environment and good opportunity

title: ‘I had a good experience with BUPA aged care.’
pros: Relaxed environment.
cons: Lots of paperwork to be done per shift.

title: ‘The best opportunity to succeed in the sales and be best you couldBe’
pros: Great job great people great environment
cons: The targets but it's all in working together as the team

title: ‘Sometimes it's hard to work with the management seems like too much politics’
pros: Bupa values,appreciating staff(PB high 5)
cons: Residents

title: ‘Love working for Bupa.’
pros: Employee health and wellness.
cons: Changing environment.
location: Coffs Harbour, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Loving it’
pros: Great balance with home and work, great employee benefits including discounts and generous salary and commission structure
cons: Cbd location so public transport can be frustrating

title: ‘Good working environment’
pros: Environment, very nice and comfortable environment to work
cons: Team work, the team sometime lack ability to work together

title: ‘Retail with a view’
pros: A very diverse company with people from many backgrounds
cons: It is essentially a retail health role with high sales targets attached

title: ‘Horrible’
pros: Lovely residents that deserved more. Lovely staff that deserved to be treated better
cons: Over coing managment

title: ‘Lack of training and no one cares about the customers. It was all about KPIs’
pros: Cheaper health insurance for staff
cons: Management who were in experienced and under pressure

title: ‘I loved the residents and job title but found management was terrible.’
pros: Residents. Kind staff.
cons: I found personally that management was difficult.

title: ‘10 years into a 2 week placement’
pros: Very supportive business with a strong urge to always do right by the customer
cons: Lots of different businesses can lead to lots of balls in the air

title: ‘A big learning curve’
pros: The residents were good
cons: Management not supporting staff and other managers

title: ‘Awesome’
pros: Good team work and work environment
cons: N/A. Didn't face any challenges in my work place.

title: ‘Amazing’
pros: Everything, great work life balance
cons: Closing down stores and restructures

title: ‘Not a nice place to work’
pros: Great team of ains and eens on my shifts
cons: High work load understaffed

title: ‘Love my job and my residents but management have killed morale in the workplace’
pros: Team work, mateship and co workers are wonderful
cons:
Poor staff to resident ratio. Overworked. 
Minimal support and respect from management team

title: ‘A very good experience meeting different people from different backgrounds working together’
pros: Bupa is an international company and stands out from the crowd with its unique Brand. You can cross over job roles aswell as continents
cons: To still be here when I retire

title: ‘It was okay but wouldn't recommend anyone to work here’
pros: If you work a Saturday you get one day off during the week
cons: Your targets are shocking. They expect way too much

title: ‘Not the worst but not the best.’
pros: Subsidy to participate in health activities like 'around the bay'
cons: Immature Project Management structures. Poor quality of Project staff, especially Project managers. No new blood, most management are those been there for >20 years and still set in old ways.

title: ‘I enjoy caring for the residents and working with the team.’
pros: . Company has high ideals. Education opportunities for all. Some great staff on the team.
cons: A lot of talk about Bupa values but often not translated into reality

title: ‘Worst company and experience ever.’
pros: Lunch breaks because you got to get out of the hole.
cons: Manager with no skills. Commission that was totally unrealistic. They had a coach who talked about narcotics more than helping!

title: ‘Micro management amd ridiculous hours focus on profit and mor eesident care’
pros: Staff are committed to excellence in resident caee
cons: Systems and processes take middle management away from resisenr care amd staff supervision

title: ‘Ordinary.’
pros: Bupa provided good product and process training.
cons: Very unsupportive back of house departments. Poor upper management direction and communication.

title: ‘Good experience if you are a beginner’
pros: Good team
cons: Heavy workload

title: ‘Supportive employer with global opportunities’
pros: Supportive managers and global job opportunities
cons: Silos between different departments

title: ‘Great culture, very tough work’
pros: It's a state of the art call centre and the management truly want to make it a positive culture.
cons: The calls were challenging. Almost every encounter is trying to turn a negative into a positive. People usually only call when there is a problem. Very high call load.

title: ‘Great workplace’
pros: Great work environment
cons: Low pay and late shifts

title: ‘Good steady job if you have no aspirations’
pros: Helping people with their health cover
cons:
Complaints about price 
Complaints about cover
Feel like a broken record with the conversations
Management are passive aggressive

title: ‘Love it!’
pros: The people are really nice, lots of help from management for career progress and training. Lot's of support.
cons: There's not a lot of social activity which makes it harder to connect to the other teams within the company.

title: ‘Structured environment with a strong ethic on team & well-being’
pros: Rewarded for exceeding goals
cons: Large organisation, not always dynamic in change

title: ‘Started great finished terribly.’
pros: People that you work directly with
cons: Management. Very much if you are liked you get ahead and willing to not challenge authority otherwise they make it hard for you

title: ‘When things are good, their good but when their bad they are bad.. Very lil support to deal with the stressful workload etc’
pros: Met some amazing people.
cons:
Work life balance was not a priority and often made it difficult. Management was unprofessional in terms of  nothing was confidential, very immature and often at times felt like you were dealing with school children. 
Has changed heaps, more work and still the same pay. KPI's have become unrealistic and now pushing sales of general insurance.

title: ‘Very frustrating in that management purported to want change, but then did everything to frustrate and prevent the changes. ’
pros: Good workplace diversity. Some very good people at the coalface.
cons: Management in the stone age. Talk of agile, but contractual arrangements with an outside company prevented doing Scrum. Also, very hard to get decisions made. Everything had to go through committees. Nobody felt they could make a decision.

title: ‘Do yourself a favour and work here!’
pros: Really good culture and great opportunities to progress your career.
cons: As with all offices I have worked in, there are some politics, but not heaps!

title: ‘It's been challenging but really enjoying.’
pros: Excellent staff-management relationship and high standard care for our residents.
cons: Adjusting to the new changes made by immediate past co managing director. Fear of losing all we have  built as a team with recent restructuring.

title: ‘I cant there is too many emotions’
pros: The staff are lovely and caring and good people. Still friends with most of the people i worked with.
cons: Staff to patient/ resident  load but its similar or higher in most  other age care

title: ‘A disappointment’
pros: Caring for the elderly
cons: Listening to the Bupa values and knowing the company doesn’t live by them

title: ‘Great ppl to work with’
pros: Recognised world wide
cons: Internal communications

title: ‘Low pay but a great job.’
pros: Fun and enjoyable work
cons: Being recognised by managers who aren't interested

title: ‘I have ups and downs and sadness’
pros: The people you work with different nationalities
cons: Difficult residents some are very challenging at times they all have different needs and wants

title: ‘You need to play politics to survive.’
pros: SYDNEY OFFICE LOCATED IN A GREAT SPOT IN THE CITY.
cons: Senior marketing management very political and not very smart.

title: ‘Overall great company and place to work if you have a decent manager’
pros: Great staff benefits and employee rewards programs
cons: Senior management very clicky, only promote friends rather then performing employees

title: ‘I have learnt a lot but I'm always looking for a new opportunity’
pros: Lots of diversity and benefits for employees
cons: Not enough room for movement as WA is a small team. It's harder to progress.  Plus the salaries should be higher for what you are expected to do.

title: ‘To achieve  a goal’
pros: Well managed , friendly  environment.
cons: Team work , time management.

title: ‘The role was very junior than what it was made out to be’
pros: Most people were friendly
cons: Not having a proper job deescription, support or training provided

title: ‘Cost cutting takes over care provision’
pros: Residents and care staff
cons: No communication from management or appreciation

title: ‘Thought it would be the best but turned out the worst.’
pros: Some of the heart working staff and our service users
cons:
Under staffing

title: ‘Glad I’ve left’

Communication with management

title: ‘It has its pros and cons’
pros: Residents and co workers
cons: Getting staff to work extra or obtaining staff due to work loads when short

title: ‘A very friendly working environment.’
pros: Employee benefits and recognition for promotions
cons: Time is precious and coming on time is very important.Make sure advise your manager in advance if you can't make it to work.

title: ‘Good for those who doesn’t want career development.’
pros: Bupa follows the EBA. Working hours are negotiable to fit your work life balance.
cons: Work politics have no evidence.

title: ‘I am happy to work there’
pros: Sensitive management

title: ‘An absolute headache and burnt out’
pros: You can take days off whenever you feel like it

title: ‘Glad to be out of there.’

title: ‘Great’

title: ‘It's a good company to work at in general, however there are some limitations in certain part of the business.’

title: ‘I had a poor experience due to pressures to do things outside of policy guidelines’
pros: There were good benefits particularly around health insurance
cons: Management pressure employees to do things outside of their own policies. When challenged this is very much frowned upon.

title: ‘Never been treated as unprofessionally anywhere EVER’
pros: Good people at lower levels

title: ‘Work & life balance’
pros: Work life balance insurance discount
cons: Opportunity to move up

title: ‘Yes for a stable job, but no room for development’
pros: Average pay, good customer base
cons: It's not a fair roster to work with, management won't do much about it even they know the problems

title: ‘Great place to work if you have no ambition and another source of income.’
pros: Happy environment, good facilities, good team leaders.
cons: Making ends meet on the poor salary offered

title: ‘Experience taught me to keep going no matter what’
pros: Always had something to do
cons: Remembering which technique works with what task

title: ‘Good workplace. Not a very good management.’
pros: Liked my workmates. The place is nice, good equipments.
cons: Poor communication between employees and management

title: ‘Loved working there but top management not approachable.’
pros: The training and chance for promotion is highly recommended
cons: Top management, privacy and confidentiality was very poor.

title: ‘I love working for bupa’
pros: The residents that what makes me wanting to go to work

title: ‘Fulfilling career path’
pros: Bupa offers great employee programs to help you grow and develop
cons: Targets are reasonable, but like any job there is pressure to achieve.

title: ‘The place to work’
pros: Convenient location, friendly environment, flexible work hours.
cons: A lot of new projects.

title: ‘Quite fortunate and happy to work at Bupa’
pros: Open and flexible environment, fair growth opportunities
cons: The organisation is too big and can sometimes slow down simple things.

title: ‘Overall good place for working than I other company's’
pros: Flexible work/life balance
cons: Somehow to enough shifts for all staff

title: ‘AIN for BUPA’
pros: The residents are so amazing to work with.
cons: The other AINs aren't so nice all the time.

title: ‘Easy going’
pros: Meeting new people and getting to know the residents.
cons: Trying to satisfy everyone
location: Baulkham Hills, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Good place, great work environment, money could be better’
pros: Work life balance, staff around me
cons: Heavy workload, change over of staff.

title: ‘Nice’
pros: Safe and friendly environment, people centred, great duty_merits training programs...
cons: More organized in front line: team leaders' training on job allocating

title: ‘Find something else’
pros: Good opportunity to move around
cons: Management were not helpful or caring. Targets were unrealistic

title: ‘Eye opening’
job_title: AIN My Hourly Wage Is $22.48 An Hour
pros: Usually working with people of similar mindset.  Satisfaction that your making a difference in someone's life.  (Aged Care)
cons:
Lack of staff due to poor pay, staff usually have two jobs, Bupa gets second place due to low wage and heavy work load on your shift.  
Management only see the $$$ and the profit, not interested in 'person first' or how hard it is on the floor.

title: ‘Needs to find a healthier work environment’
pros: Salary was competitive
cons:
Clarity of roles across the organisation
Leadership quality and strength
Legacy systems

title: ‘Decrease my passion towork in agedcare’
pros: Plenty shifts available
cons: Short staff poor hand over

title: ‘Tiring and lacking of focus’
pros:
Focus on health 
Nice office 
Invest in health
cons: Politics and too many chiefs

title: ‘Not great for someone with a life’
pros: Some of the people were fantastic.
cons: The management was disappointing. Incompetent. The changes to shifts so rapidly with constant late shifts was ridiculous as they wouldn't allow swaps/changes

title: ‘Overall it's a good company to work for, but it's not as good as it used to be.’
pros: Rewards you with financial benefits if you hit your monthly KPIs, you get 50% off of your health insurance (it does save you a lot of money) Great products and employee benefits.
cons:
- Sales target is constantly raising each year
- Monthly target is unrealistic to achieve with the current economic cycle.  
-They only care about your sales figures, they literally treat people like numbers. 
- Career development is a joke. Interview for internal vacancies could drain you dry.

title: ‘Really enjoyed my stay’
pros: Very flexible work place
cons: Complex reporting environment

title: ‘A very good company to work for , excellent communication .’
pros: Education and updated certificate are available
cons: The challenges are working in the  dementia ward understaffed.

title: ‘Met some great people, but middle management need some work.’
pros: Great perks and discounts provided for employees. Great company values.
cons: Middle management does nothing to look after staff and morale is low in certain departments.

title: ‘Fairly nice place to work for but very political’
pros: Fairly mature project management processes in place. Using project server can be considered a plus. Good teamwork activities.
cons: Very political environment. Not enough support provided by management. In particular my role was set for failure as it was driving change in project management with little support from management.

title: ‘Much much better place to work’
pros:
Manager change for my team has resumed its long gone stressful environment and is now more flexible and relaxed as it used to be. 
Starting at 10 am not earlier, and having breaks when I choose to have them.
cons: Dealing with uncomfortable situations like rostered on taking inbound calls but setting own challenges and trying new tbings. Keeping up with KPIs day to day.

title: ‘Just great, like a family with lots of perks and career variety’
pros: Fresh fruit and barista on site( free) and free newspapers. Great location. Friendly. Career opportunities.
cons: Contract to start( temp) but full time role recruitment exists too. Hardest thing is getting in the door ina popular organization.

title: ‘At this time, I would not recommend Bupa to my friends.’
pros: Friendly staff but poor management,
cons: Before when I first started, I love working here. Has a good team and good support from the management, Now most of the RN/EN are unhappy because of the workload. This company has a recent changes that for me is very unsafe or might not satisfied the needs of residents. Short staffing. RN on the floor reduced. More loads for the RN and EN. Low salary.

title: ‘Claim to be resident focused however their focus is more directed toward profit over care. Expectation of staff is over and above paid hours.’
pros: The residents and their families are always a privilege to know and learn from.
cons: Several - hours required to undertake the role were far in excess of paid hours. On call 24/7. Minimal staffing. Minimal support.

title: ‘A very interesting job, always somewhere different, keeps the work varied.’
pros: The best thing about Bupa Wellness, is that I get to travel all over Australia, work for different companies everyday, and meet new people.
cons: Not having permanent hours, but this may change, as I'm getting enough hours, except over January.

title: ‘A great place to come to every day to work due to the great people who work here.’
pros:
A great team and very wonderful people. Very high moral and great managment.
I loved working at Bupa.
cons: You learn new skills all the time and build your knowledge which is great but means you need to have the same KPI for more work load. However as someone who loves to be challenged I found it great.

title: ‘Interested in sales not service’
pros: It was enjoyable being able to help customers & give them great customer service
cons: They say that they care about customers but they are only interested in getting new members not keeping & assisting existing customers.  Some supervisors do not treat staff fairly.

title: ‘Overall, a very good workplace to work in’
pros: Strong team and good management staff members operate through most of the branches. Carousel, Garden City and Joondalup branches have outstanding branch managers
cons: Downturn in the economy has made it harder to hit targets. Also started during a period where it was understaffed, creating a lot of challenges

title: ‘A great place to be  - a career can be built here.’
pros: The career opportunities are great, but you need to do the work to earn it. People complain about not having developmnet opportunities 'given' to them. The work environment is fab. The leadership team are excellent and the people overall are very friendly and accepting.
cons: Its such a big complex organisation, it can feel a bit like turning a ship to get things done. But it's worth it.

title: ‘If your looking for work/life balance, keep looking.’
pros:
- Benifits and Discounts
- Peer to peer rewards system
- Onsite Batista
- Fruit drops twice a week
- The co-workers make it easier to be there everyday
- Monday til Friday work
cons:
- Next to no work/life balance at all.
-  You cannot apply for leave in March or July
-  Aweful rosters
-  Late shifts almost every 2nd or 3rd week.
-  Lack of communication at times
-  Leaders scoulds centre at times
-  So many workplace secrets
-  HR team extremely hard to get hold of, no contact numbers
-  Unrealistic KPIs.
-  Things that need attention, dont get looked into.
-  Things that don't need attention, gets looked into or changed.
-  Staff feedback survey, just to make staff feel like they get some feedback, but this isn't the case.

title: ‘Have been a very happy employee. Lots of opportunities for people to grow and develop.’
pros: Excellent company culture
cons: Demolishing the silos

title: ‘Great team environment, poor pay, poor management’
pros: Friendly Colleagues, good location
cons: Management is poor - not willing to help or encourage what so ever.

title: ‘I'm waiting until some new roll is advertised to change.’
pros: We receive a box of fruits every Monday for the staff.
cons: The roll is really repetitive.

title: ‘Good work environment overall’
pros: Friendly and supportive staff
cons: Wages, loss of acute clinical skills

title: ‘Disillusionment with the big blue box’
pros: Great location; modern office
cons: While the organisation promotes their values these are not upholded or practiced by the management team. This fostered a climate of uncertainty and fear where job security and promotion was based on internal politics not skills

title: ‘A huge learning experience.’
pros: Great people, diverse cultures, very understanding of university students.
cons: Driving to and from work (40mins to and 40mins from)
location: Canberra, Stirling, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

title: ‘Would never go back’
pros:
Good working team 
residents are beautiful
cons: Horrible place to work

title: ‘Lack of Clinical Governance’
pros: The residents we care for are the only thing that makes my day at work.
cons: Working for a company that is hipcritical about their care for their residents

title: ‘Understaffed, unnapreciated & disrespected’
pros: Rostering system, pay day
cons: Working understaffed & with poor quality staff

title: ‘Good learning but no opportunity to grow’
pros: People are treated well
cons: No property systems or structure

title: ‘Great Workplace’
pros: Great Staff and Residents, Great Community with Great Communication skills.
cons: Different Residents may make things abit Challenging for their care.

title: ‘Restricted in career development’
pros: Flexibility with work hours
cons: Career progression was a road block

title: ‘Great experience, would have preferred to stay but, was not prepared to move to Melb’
pros: Bupa are very good at managing change for their people.  Know how to take them on the journey & show genuine concern when people are struggling with any change.  Their staff medical insurance is great, especially if you have children.
cons: The main challenge is that the majority of the senior roles are in Melb.

title: ‘Regretful.’
pros: Location. Some nice people work there but are outnumbered by policital players.
cons: Trying to implement change in a toxic, hostile, incompetent environment.

title: ‘Ridiculous workloads for staff, always understaffed. No continuity of care for residents, very sad and disheartening to see.’
pros: Nursing and care staff are hardworking.
cons:
Understaffed, staff are overwhelmed with huge workloads. The Bupa values are not adhered too by anyone, especially management.
I struggled to believe in the product i was asked to be selling.

title: ‘Dont work there!’
pros: None. Not a nice place to work.
cons: Bosses, money, shifts

title: ‘Amaizing’
pros: Good environment, good people, everybody respect you and you can feel that you have a family there. I love Bupa.
cons: If you learn quickly you wil improve your career there

title: ‘Great place to work’
pros: Good people to work with
cons: The work can be challenging at times

title: ‘Challenging role but learnt a lot’
pros: The discounts and benefits
cons: The targets and some people I worked with

title: ‘My expectations weren’t met.’
pros: Bupa overall provides great services.
cons: It is a very who you know environment to move up in development. Lack of growth support.

title: ‘I enjoyed working for a company with good values’
pros: Working for such a big company gives you more career progression
cons: For me it wasn't a role I wanted to continue on, I wanted to veer my career in a different path.

title: ‘I am really don't want to advice to work in bupa aged care i don't about it's other different work-field.’
pros: Nothing good about bupa aged care.
cons: Management is terrible

title: ‘Lack of support from management and understaffed’
pros: Residents and family's
cons: Bad communication with management

title: ‘Great culture with supportive management’
pros:
Great  communication from the management re how well
The company is performing financially n changes within the company
cons: Companies operate in different ststem

title: ‘I was given great challenging work and a friendly environment which is what I was looking for in an employer.’
pros: Friendly people, great culture, good  work/life balance
cons: Provided limited formal training. Mostly on the job or compliance related.

title: ‘Good experience,’
pros: Good staff training and guidance
cons: Time management ,paper works

title: ‘Would never go back, bupa looks great from the outside but is terrible on the inside. Low pay and no understanding, consideration or problem solving from management.’
pros: New facility, modern, person centred care.
cons: Extremely understaffed for months on end making it impossible to deliver reasonable care to residents. Management that would not listen to complaints let alone help with a solution. No where near the amount of equipment needed for adequate time management of a shift and often being expected to use equipment alone. The pay rate for what your expected to do is pathetic. I have worked in other facilities and they all have things that can be improved but nothing in comparison to bupa in my opinion.

title: ‘Perfect balance or work and home life working for Bupa’
pros:
Great recruitment process which really fits the people to their role. 
Also great employee benefits
cons: Nothing really. Aged care is a great industry, and Bupa is leading the way

title: ‘No recognition for actual workers, just political players.’
pros: Reasonably flexible business hours. Some working from home.
cons: Too much weekend work. Everything needs to be done yesterday. Politics interferes with work on a daily basis. Management want to be agile because its the in thing and, therefore, nothing is planned or implemented properly

title: ‘Hated it big mistake joining the company’
pros: Can't think of anything
cons: Having to work under staffed all the time

title: ‘My experience to date has been fantastic, it is great to work for a company who truly recognises potential in their employees and will do everything to support that potential’
pros:
Supportive work environment
Work/life balance
Truly cares about their employees
cons: WA is just a small part of a much larger business

title: ‘I loved my time at Bupa, the only downside was that many of the career oportunities were Melbourne based.’
pros: Good culture, care about staff, genuinely believe in their mission.
cons: Political, long approval processes, Melbourne based head office can leave Sydney staff out of the loop.

title: ‘Great growth and experience but limited on innovation and encouraging strong leaders.’
pros: They mean we’ll but have trouble executing.
cons: Mostly old school and traditional in approach and initiatives.

title: ‘I have an emotional relationship with my company BUPA. I love to work at BUPA.’
pros: Culture, opportunities, people, values
cons: Process related challenges which causes some small issues but the executive people are very keen and open to resolve these issues.

title: ‘Good memories and experience but could have been great!’
pros: Nice teams, nice stores to work in, small benefits like getting treats/fruit baskets from head office during busy periods
cons: Taking leaves is a bit tricky in sales. Internal movement is tough.

title: ‘Average’
pros: Opportunities for career
cons: Heavy workload at time without overtime pay

title: ‘Management do not look after there staff , loyalty to staff is low , there is no encouragement or reward for work that is done’
pros: Nice residents who deserve good care
cons: Management do not look after staff and staff ratios have been severely affected of late

title: ‘It's ok, but need improvement’
pros: The people are great! my colleagues are the best part of the job!
cons: The growth in the company is shocking. Was promised when starting the role that the growth was great but every opportunity I've had has either been taken away or has been \"cancelled\"

title: ‘Should have done it earlier in my life and although it was not the rewarding financially, it was personally the most satisfying job I had ever done.’
pros: The fun times with the residents
cons: Frequent under staffing

title: ‘Average’
pros: Was great when it was mbf really cared about the customers. You get discount in health insurance
cons: All bupa  ares about now is sell sell sell, health car travel income protection, with little regard of the customer, i ended up leaving due to the pressure of having a manager stand behind you at certain times, asking why you didnt try to sell the customer more insurance

title: ‘Non caring about their staff who go above and beyond.’
pros: The wonderful elderly residents. And most work colleagues.
cons: No clear direction from management or support.

title: ‘Love everything about bupa’
pros: There are caring staff throw out the nursing home i have been there for 2yrs and love it wouldn't work anywhere else
cons: Every day is a challenge

title: ‘Bupa looks after everyone’
pros: Great culture, great people that had a passion and desire to help customers
cons: Sales target are high and due to the economic climate, it is a tough market

title: ‘Exhausting’
pros: Free coffee, free fruit, the occasional game to break the monotony.
cons: Zero work life balance if you don't live close to work. Extremely hard to find childcare when your hours are constantly changing.

title: ‘The most embarrassingly low paid job for what you have to know and do.   Horrendous management up to state level.  Scarred for life’
pros: Discounts ,some great people you meet and helping people
cons: Management,  targets,  staffing levels,  work loads.

title: ‘Felt like progression within Bupa wasn't realistic.’
pros: Close by public transport.
cons: Standing out from a huge crowd of staff.

title: ‘Worst job I ever had overall as an RN. Looking for anything better.’
pros: Some staff and most of the residents.
cons: Low morale, 3 managers in 4 months, little to no support from other RN’s, unrealistic workload if you want to do your job properly and deliver good care. One RN for 50 residents and you’re expected to finish everything on day shift. Expected to work back for free daily with no appreciation. Docked pay for being a minute late.

title: ‘Rewarding’
pros: Friends
cons: No challenges

title: ‘Fantastic customer service skills many years of sales experience’
pros: If you work hard Bupa reward you very well the recognition is fantastic
cons: I work in a remote area so relief staff is a real issue sometimes we are working alone and this can be a real challenge

title: ‘Very diverse and varied’
pros: Bupa provides you with all the on the job training required. Also the additional benefit of an employee discount for your health insurance and other insurance policies
cons: Day to day work can be mundane

title: ‘Good workers,poor management’
pros: Had some good people to work with
cons: Under staffed a lot - still expecting staff to do everything making it very stressful- couple times a week.

title: ‘Made my anxiety got sky high stress leave’
pros: Break times when we got them
cons: Work load, short staff, expectations in short time, management always changing

title: ‘No understanding.’
pros: Some nice staff members.
cons: Bad management. Nasty manager.

title: ‘Supportive but overly collaborative’
pros: Inclusion, cultural awareness
cons: Red tape, lack of clean decision making

title: ‘Bupa looks great from the outside but once I was inside I was let down by the internal tools, processes and management support to perform my role effectively’
pros: Excellent head office working environment and great Customer focus
cons: Let down by poor internal systems, broken internal processes and lack of management strategy

title: ‘Short staffed, low pay and dreadful environment’
pros: The residents are lovely!
cons: Management have no idea on cares for clients

title: ‘Hated it would never work there again or put loved ones in there’
pros: Nothing good at all. You are just a number under staff very poor management
cons: Doing your work on time an finished before you leave to bad you are under staff working on your own with 30 ederly people with broken equipment

title: ‘Hard work pays off’
pros: Great career opportunites
cons: Need to start at the bottom and be patient

title: ‘Would not recommend to anyone’
pros: The discount on health insurance
cons: Closed and manipulative executive

title: ‘Toxic enviroment to work and very unexperienced managemnet’
pros: Big company, system in place lots of data and lots of nice people
cons: Bureaucracy, slow processes and convoluted.

title: ‘They dont really care about their staff it is all about money’
pros: The good things was getting to talk to interesting residents who came to stay at bupa
cons: Getting staff to change their ways to make residents who live there have quality of life

title: ‘Very supportive when things go bad outside of work’
pros: The perks with health cover were amazing
cons: Call centre work can be mentally taxing

title: ‘Worst workplace I've ever been at’
pros: Discount for health insurance
cons: Low commissions considering the work put in, terrible management and people in the office

title: ‘Second worst job I have ever had’
pros: Nice workers, hours ok,
cons: Terrible management, micromanagement, very low pay, terrible culture,

title: ‘Great work, poor leadership ’
pros:
Great team
Diverse project workload
Established brand
cons:
Unprofessional and chaotic Executive Leadership, particularly in Digital/Marketing
Organisation is too fat at the mid/top end, huge waste of customer money

title: ‘Fun place to work’
pros: Ethical and fun culture
cons: The remuneration  is not the nest but there are alot of opportunities for advancement

title: ‘A learning experience that I hope not to repeat’
pros: There were opportunities for exposure to different aspects of my role that supported some career growth
cons: The environment (IT) is somewhat toxic and plagued by indecision. Salaries are below market.

title: ‘It was very monitored, always being monitored.’
pros: My morning breaks, my lunch breaks and my afternoon breaks.
cons: Adhering to the strict monitoring on time.

title: ‘Bad experience!!’
pros: Subsidise private health insurance
cons: Extremely poor management!

title: ‘Avoid at all costs’
pros: Can't think of anything.
cons: Management in fighting, vicious blame culture, poor work environment, terrible staff discounts

title: ‘Great experience’
pros: Learning experiences.
cons: Timing and coming to terms with rules applied.

title: ‘Wost company’
pros: The residence that live there
cons: To get you work done

title: ‘Not ideal’
pros: The residents are mostly very nice
cons: Management, nurses that speak to other staff poorly and again management!

title: ‘Ok, but bad pay compared to other aged care places.’
pros: Nothing outstanding just an average place to work.  It is what you make it.
cons: Management merry go rounds.  Poor pay.  Say that their policy is that people love working at Bupa but not a reality.

title: ‘Life changing’
pros: Looking after our residents
cons: There are many but all good

title: ‘Stressful, they gave me a tremendous amount of grief during my time their.’
pros: Nothing - I would never, ever work for them again.
cons:
One toilet brake a day for  five minutes, beware you will be timed!
Then you will need to explain why you took so long.
If you talk to a customer for too long you will need to explain why, management are uncaring and stats focused, they do not care about staff only themselves and how much money they can make.

title: ‘Too high expectations without proper training program.’
pros: Close to train station.
cons: Training is very poor.

title: ‘Poor’
cons: Executive Leadership

title: ‘Wonderful delightful place to work, kept fully informed of changes’
pros: Peers
cons: Hours in a day

title: ‘Vr’
pros: Friendly staff
cons: Different place good job....

title: ‘The workload is hectic and challenging. I love what I do and the gratitude from residents and loved ones make it worthwhile.’
pros: Teaches you how to work with limited staff and to prioritise your work under pressure. Good and supportive team from other staff.
cons: Extremely short staffed. 7-9:1 resident to staff ration in the morning depending on site. No support from management at all. Not flexible or supportive for any carer development. Staff not valued. Management more concerned about making money than the staff or quality of care to residents.
